author: wrowe
msg: Once we apr_proc_kill on Unix, we don't expect to be able to recover an
exit code (in fact we waitpid on darwin to clear the zombies, which seems
like behavior we would need on other bsd-derived platforms as well.)
So we don't expect to be able to on Win32 either; this patch simply
reinforces that notion by return APR_EPROC_UNKNOWN when we encounter
an apr_proc_t that was already kill()ed or waitpid()ed.

author: wrowe
msg: If we no longer have proc->hproc, the proc itself is now useless.

author: wrowe
msg: Our exit codes are ugly, this should help some of them and tell us what
Declare apr_proc_wait_all_procs() unimplemented, and further fix the
code not to shut down the ->hproc which we need to recover the error

author: wrowe
msg: This is what Unix does, but I'm revisiting the entire ->hproc
issue in a few minutes.  At least start out in the same place.
